conbody.p:
All application alarms are written to stdout. The application alarms are the following:
Call Control alarms
Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms
Sy alarms
Rating Engine alarms
Service Model alarms
Notification Client alarms
Notification Service alarms
LDAP alarms
Service Manager alarms
Balance Manager alarms
NRF alarms AutoClear is described in the following tables as being "yes" or "true" or "no" or "false". AutoClear: yes or true means that the alarm will be cleared once the condition or scenario has recovered from whatever caused the alarm. AutoClear: no or false means that the alarm must be cleared manually.The Alarm ID given for each alarm in all of these tables is displayed on NCC for all alarms. When the NokiaEmsMib MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is not sent in the SNMP trap. However, when the NokiaEnhancedSnmpSolutionSuiteAlarmIrp MIB is used to integrate any NMS, the Alarm ID is sent in the SNMP trap.

section.title: Call Control alarms
section.p: The following table lists the alarms generated by Call Control.

Alarm uniqueness is a composite of Specific-Problem and Probable Cause. Within the list of supported Call Control alarms, some alarms have only one set of Specific-Problem + Probable-Cause while others have multiple combinations of these attribute pairings. Regardless of whether one or more combination of Specific-Problem and Probable-Cause exists, each set is considered a distinct alarm.Device Lookup Failed Alarm and Barring State Alarm are also raised by Sy. Call Control alarms
Service SpecificProblem Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics

System: No
ProbableCause: authenticationFailure
AdditionalText: DEVICEID=[SubscriptionId: <type>:<value>]

section.title: Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms
section.p:
The following table lists Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms.All alarms listed in the following table have Specific-Problem and Additional-Text values containing one or more new lines (i.e. "/n") as returned by the application's error handling code in the Subscriber Model and LifeCycle resource bundles. The representation of new lines can vary from one SNMP Manager to the next. If, for some reason, issues are encountered relating to the presence of new lines in the SNMP trap variable bindings for Specific-Problem and Additional-Text, contact Nokia Support for more information. Subscriber Model and Lifecycle alarms
Service SpecificProblem Other alarm parameters and behavioral characteristics
SUBSCRIBER Custom data dictionary attribute does not exist.
Alarm_ID: 310205
System: No
ProbableCause: softwareError
AdditionalText: ERRORDESCRIPTION=Error Reference Number: CUSTOMDATADICT_00007. The attribute "{0}" does not exist in custom data dictionary.
ERRORMESSAGE=Custom data dictionary attribute does not exist.
LOCATIONOFERROR=Subscriber Model
Where {0} contains attribute context and name.
SPECIFICREASON=Custom data dictionary does not exist.
AlarmType: processingErrorAlarm
Severity: minor
AutoClear: yes
SUBSCRIBER Invalid device identity format.
Alarm_ID: 310201
System: No
ProbableCause: softwareError
AdditionalText: ERRORDESCRIPTION=Error Reference Number: DEVICE_00004. "{0}" is not a valid value for identity type "{1}".
ERRORMESSAGE=Invalid device identity format.

Where {1} is E164, IMSI, MSISDN, NAI, SIP_URI, PRIVATE, IMEI or UUID

Severity: minor
